availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. Jones (Pendleton County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lucinda Bingham Jones in Pendleton County, Kentucky, in April 1847. Father of John Jones, Caroline Jones, Louisa Jones, Mary E. Jones, Amelia Jones, and Ames Jones. Farmer in Grant County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 345B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 512.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 6, p. 488A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, 1799-1948. Film #000272800, p. 407, p. 655 of 660 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
